data.title: invalid outDir makes extension host not start
data.body:
- start with `yo code` and a _typescript_ extension
- make changes to compile into `out2` instead of `out`
- don't change the launch.json which defines `outDir: ${workspaceRoot}/out/src`
- hit F5 >> you will see a message saying the extension host cannot start

data.title: Editors: announce currently edited document to screen readers
Understand update.channel set to none
data.body:
This fixes #2520 

There are some users which would like to prevent automatic updates. These users either set the update channel to `none` in the `storage.json` or the `settings.json`.

I want to drop `storage.json` and will explain it in the release notes/blog post. But we still need to respect disablement via the settings.

This PR brings back the setting and disables updates if the value is set to `none`.

@bpasero please review the code flow in `update-manager.ts`. Thanks.

data.title: Use original oniguruma since PR was merged in and published
Add appendText option to DecorationOptions
data.body:
`DecorationOptions` contains `hoverMessage`, it would be great to have `appendText` string option to set a text displayed to the right from the code line:

![scr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/979966/10472457/f2bc1830-7263-11e5-9149-497ee6fb27e0.gif)

The text should use styles from the `DecorationRenderOptions`.

data.title: Need to support "updateChannel": "none"
data.body:
Users that don't want automatic updates should still be given the opportunity to stay in the same version.

ping @chrisdias @egamma

data.title: Remove the dancer emoji from the salsa status indicator
data.body: The dancer emoji is rendered very different per platfrom which is confusing and I don't want to have platform specific screenshots in the release notes.

data.title: Unable to launch on Ubuntu over an X2GO session
data.body:
Trying to launch VSCode on Ubuntu 14.04, running XFCE over X2GO, I get the following error:

```
 $./Code 
 $[ , [Error: channel closed] ]

 $./Code --disable-extensions
 $[ , [Error: channel closed] ]
```

After this, the process just quits and I return to bash. I do not know the version because I am unable to launch. I downloaded the binary from the VSCode website on 28 January.

data.title: Copy/paste from debug console does not work with selected content
data.body:
Copy/paste from debug console should be applied to the highlighted content, not the whole line.
## Repro steps on Mac
- Select some content, say `port 49226`
- Right click and select `Copy Value`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5600301/12657711/9acd2ea8-c5b9-11e5-8fc6-7fa5546b7a23.png)
- Paste it somewhere

We would expect to see `port 49226`. However, the selection is ignored and `Debugger listening on port 49226` is pasted instead.

data.title: Debug actions pane often blocks file names

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Currently the debug actions pane is always displayed at the top center position. This often blocks the file names. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5600301/12657076/68b60460-c5b6-11e5-8580-cc8fc297a9fb.png)

It would be helpful to find a better place for the pane or add the ability to move the debug actions pane.

data.title: Linux Mint: Left menu bar unresponsive after closing folder.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Problem: 
After closing a folder using File > Close folder the folder it's closed but the left menu bar it's unresponsive. Close (x) button it's unresponsive also. Weirdly that i got functionality of the top menu (File, Edit, View...etc). That functionality it's verrrrry limited and weird. when i go  "File > Open File" i can open the dialog window but chosen file it's not opened.  Same with open folder. Full screen menu can be executed by mouse click but key F11 it's not working to revert the action.

Steps to reproduce:
Open vscode with a folder from a previous session.
Click File > Close Folder
left menu bar must freaze at this point.

SO: Linux Mint 17.3 
uname -a:
3.19.0-32-generic #37~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Thu Oct 22 09:41:40 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

data.title: Improve marshalling/demarshalling perf
data.body: There is some room for improvement when it comes to preparing the data we exchange between the ext host and the main thread and vice versa. Our current `cloneAndChange` function fails to be optimised by the VM since it's parameter types constantly change. Also, since stuff is JSON anyways we might be better off using the `replacer` and `reviver` args in `stringify` and `parse`. Last, marshalling should not rely on iterating through all contributions, but they should be known by some sort of identifier.
